name: Money
intro: Zakat on cash and savings is a core obligation for every Muslim who owns wealth above the nisab for a full lunar year. It purifies your wealth and supports those in need.

evidences.text: Take, [O Muhammad], from their wealth a charity by which you purify them and cause them increase...
Zakat expenditures are only for the poor and for the needy...
The Prophet (ï·º) said: 'There is no zakat on wealth until a year passes.'

conditions: Owns wealth above the nisab (minimum threshold) for one lunar year (hawl).
Wealth is fully owned and accessible.
calculation: Add all your cash, bank balances, and savings. Subtract any debts due. If the remaining amount is above the nisab, pay 2.5%.
example: Example: You have $5,000 in savings. You owe $500. Your net is $4,500. If the nisab is $4,000, you pay 2.5% of $4,500 = $112.50.
madhhabNotes: Hanafi: Nisab is based on silver (595g).
Maliki/Shafi'i/Hanbali: Nisab is based on gold (85g).
All: Zakat is 2.5% after one lunar year.

faq.q: What is the nisab for cash?
Can I pay zakat before a year passes?
faq.a: Permissible, but best after hawl. See: https://islamqa.info/en/answers/26120/paying-zakaah-before-one-year-has-passed

faq.q: Do I include money lent to others?
faq.a: Yes, if you expect repayment. See: https://islamqa.info/en/answers/1464/zakaah-on-loans-given-to-others

faq.q: Is zakat due on children's savings?
Can I pay zakat in advance?
faq.a: Yes, but best to wait for hawl. See: https://islamqa.info/en/answers/26120/paying-zakaah-before-one-year-has-passed
Only immediate debts due within the year are subtracted. See: https://islamqa.info/en/answers/22426/does-he-have-to-pay-zakaah-on-money-from-which-he-will-pay-off-a-debt

faq.q: What if my wealth fluctuates during the year?
faq.a: If at both the start and end of the year you are above nisab, zakat is due. See: https://islamqa.info/en/answers/2795/nisab-of-zakaah-in-grams-of-gold-and-silver

faq.q: Can I give zakat to family?
faq.a: You may give to relatives except parents, children, and spouse. See: https://islamqa.info/en/answers/21810/giving-zakaah-to-relatives
